questions.question: The Spanish Inquisition was established for which purpose?

choices.answer: rooting out heresies,  converting the heretic and correctiong the heresy
burning those identified as witches
condemning rulers who sought to tax the clergy
maintaining Catholic orthodoxy in Spain

questions.question: Which of the following events widened the split between the Eastern and Western Churches during the Fourth Crusade?

choices.answer: The Crusaders lost Jerusalem to the Turks.
The Crusaders pillaged Constantinople, vandalizing and sacred places
The Crusaders lacked the resources to carry out the military campaign.
The children who marched in the Crusade died or were enslaved.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the Great Western Schism?

choices.answer: a split within the Church that lasted from 1378 to 1417
the divide between the Eastern (Greek) and Western (or Roman) Churches
the conflict between the Pope and the kings of England and France over tax
the tendency for the Church to excommunicate anyone who disagreed with it

questions.question: Which of the following characterized the Franciscan order, founded during the High Middle Ages?

choices.answer: an emphasis on prayer and work (ora et labora)
monastic life, secluded from the general population
imitating Christ and his poverty by begging for sustenance
a way of life dedicated to combating heresy through preaching

questions.question: Which of the following was not a factor in the weakening of the papacy in thirteenth and fourteenth centuries?

choices.answer: the rise of nationalism, when people felt stronger loyalty to their nation
Pope Clement V’s move of the Church’s headquarters from Rome to Avignon
the Black Death
the Conciliar movement, that gave Church councils supremacy over the popes

questions.question: The canons issued by Lateran Council IV accomplished all of the following except ___________.

choices.answer: defining Transubstantiation
affirming Mary’s role as Mother of God
establishing the seal of confession
enforcing clerical celibacy and ended the practice of simony

questions.question: Stained glass in medieval cathedrals served which of the following functions?

choices.answer: depicted events from Sacred Scripture and Church history
provided beautiful light to illuminate the space and inspire worshippers
served as a method of religious instruction for the large illiterate group
all of the above

questions.question: The aims of medieval scholasticism included all of the following except ___________.

choices.answer: teaching illiterate churchgoers how to read
arriving at the truth by dialogue and dialectical reasoning among people
reconciling the logic of Aristotle with the truths of the Church
pursuing all scientific learning, especially knowledge about God
The Byzantine emperor asked Pope Urban II for protection against invaders
The Turks besieged Jerusalem, destroyed the Church of the Holy Sepulchre
The Turks were preventing Christian pilgrims from visiting Jerusalem
All of the above

questions.question: The Medieval (or Papal) Inquisition was established for which purpose?

choices.answer: rooting out heresies,  converting the heretic and correctiong the heresy
burning those identified as witches
condemning rulers who sought to tax the clergy
maintaining Catholic orthodoxy in Spain
